intro: Pycnarrhena novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea pycnarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests.
